summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors between 1994 and 1997, and for perjury in 2016 depositions. It details her alleged role in grooming and facilitating abuse and announces her arrest in New Hampshire.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with enticing and transporting minors for illegal sex acts and perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing minor victims with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell between 1994 and 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged crimes and role in Epstein's abuse scheme.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement commending the victims for their bravery and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement condemning the alleged crimes and commending investigators.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Assigned to preside over Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, transport, and sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's abuse of minors and, in some cases, participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in the morning and charged in a Manhattan federal court indictment.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, with victims as young as 14.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed
events.description: The indictment detailing charges against Ghislaine Maxwell was unsealed in Manhattan federal court.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, transporting a minor for criminal sexual activity, and perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein abused girls as young as 14 between 1994 and 1997, with Maxwell playing a critical grooming role.
Abuse and grooming allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell was charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery and condemning the crimes.
